title: We Stand on the Shoulders of Giants: Family Encouragement for the Young Professional
content: One of the most common questions I receive is “How did you get into decomposition?” The second most common question is “Did you tell your wife about your work when you started dating?” I learned that the second question was easier to answer than the first (the answer being that I did not go into a lot of details early in our relationship). Answering the first question was a challenge. While it’s a logical question given the nature of my work in forensic entomology and sustainable agriculture, I must admit that for the longest time, I did not have a good response. In fact, as my research has diversified and evolved over 29 years, I have concluded that defining myself is the culmination of genetics and a host of life experiences (and yes, I just referenced gene–environment interactions [GxE]).
